author: Staff Reporter
text:
A flying squad in charge of election dutyseized Rs. 22 lakh from a Kerala businessman near Uduamlpet on Wednesday.

Revenue Divisional Officer (Udumalpet) A. Shadhanaikural told The Hindu that the businessman’s car was intercepted at Poolavadi along Udumalpet-Tirupur Road as part of the checking under way to detect flow of unaccounted cash that could possibly be used to lure voters.

“It has been found that he was coming from Thrissur in Kerala and was proceeding to Tirupur with Rs. 22 lakh. The cash was seized as he could not produce documents to substantiate from where he withdrew the cash, though he stated that amount was meant for purchase of land”, Mr. Shadhanaikural said.

The revenue officials transferred the amount to the district treasury and informed the Income Tax officials about the seizure since the sum carried by the businessman was above Rs. 10 lakh.

In another incident, a flying squad constituted for Tirupur North Assembly constituency had seized Rs. 5.67 lakh from Ganesh Vasanth at Kannakkampalayam. Tahsildar (Tirupur North) S. Murugadoss said the man was carrying cash to be given to someone, but he did not have documents to prove the source from where the cash was brought.
title: Rs. 22 lakh seized from Kerala businessman
